page.title: 03HOUSING AND POPULATION
page.content: Most of the block is rural farmland but there are four main places where people live. The biggest is Stockton on Forest with about 250 houses.The main part of the village is 200 years old but Stone Riggs Council Estate built about 1950 has 74 houses.Kings Moor private estate has 85 houses built about 1965. In Stockton parish is Hopgrove which is cut off by the York by-pass.There are 56 houses there, one shop and one pub. About two miles away is Warthill which has its own church and 54 houses but no shops. Another mile further on is Holtby which also has an old church and 45 houses and no shops.
